thread.title: Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat
thread.title_full: Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat

author: tgannon
title: Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat
text:
Comments JESE had a Las Palmas debut to forget by missing a game-changing three-yard sitter. 
The on-loan Paris Saint-Germain winger had a golden opportunity to level the score after coming on as a second-half sub. EPA 9 Jese had a Las Palmas debut to forget by missing from just three yards out 
Las Palmas launched an attack down the right flank, firing in a brilliant ball across the box and leaving keeper Guillermo Ochoa well beaten. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news, gossip and rumours 
In truth, it was harder for Jese to miss than score. 
But the ex-Real Madrid ace was left with his head in his hands after amazingly cushioning the ball back across goal. Sky Sports A dangerous ball is fired across the box towards Las Palmas winger Jese Sky Sports The on-loan Paris Saint-Germain star has an open goal to aim at as the ball nears Sky Sports Jese has a horror moment as he cushions the ball back across goal Sky Sports Granada’s defence are able to clear easily after Jese misses a sitter Sky Sports It looks harder for Jese to miss the goal than to score EPA Jese cannot believe his rotten luck after failing to score on his Las Palmas debut Related Stories Mad for Fab Real Madrid eye stunning move for Chelsea star Cesc Fabregas despite him playing for rivals Barcelona Real Deal Real Madrid 'look into forming European Super League' after fall out with La Liga over match postponement 'I'm joining Blues' Alvaro Morata sensationally tells Real Madrid he wants to join Antonio Conte's Chelsea this summer no way, jose Pep Guardiola to fight Manchester United over Turkish defender - but he's a big Jose Mourinho fan Mad for it Antoine Griezmann wants to be the new David Beckham as blockbuster £60million move to Manchester United takes a step closer 
His devastating miss meant Granada ran out winners of the match, with Manchester United loanee Andreas Pereira scoring a first-half rocket after initially failing to control the ball. 
The Brazilian fired a blistering shot into the top right which keeper Javi Varas could not get near. 
Belgian Pereira, 21, said: “I wasn’t able to control the ball correctly. But I made up for it with the shot. Getty Images Manchester United’s on-loan star Andreas Pereira was in action for Granada EPA The Belgian scored a wonder goal to win the match for Granada 
“Hopefully this is a new beginning for us.” 
Jese, 23, admitted he was disappointed with his miss. 
He said: “I’m happy with the debut, but not with the loss and the missed opportunities.” Aurah Ruiz trains dolphins with PSG forward Jese and shows off her sexy swimsuit
